documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from a footnote in the Schedule of Activities (Table 1) to Section 8 for details on procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference from Risk Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy table (Table 3) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation strategies.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive design features of the study.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Adaptive Protocol Features table (Table 4) to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria Reference for Blood Donation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Lifestyle Considerations table (Table 5) to Section 5.2, which details the exclusion criterion related to blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Methods Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Lifestyle Considerations table (Table 5) to Section 10.4 for a description of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria Reference for Contraception
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Lifestyle Considerations table (Table 5) to Section 5.1 for information on contraceptive start times.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA Reference for Discontinuation Procedures
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the Schedule of Activities (SoA) for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding discontinuation from study intervention due to pregnancy.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Lab Tests List Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.2 to Section 10.3 for methods of recording, evaluating, and assessing causality of AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Policy Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7, confirming that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details of molybdenum measured in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics Biomarkers Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details of pharmacodynamic biomarkers like total copper, PUF-copper, and ceruloplasmin.

commentAnnotations.text: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Samples collected within ± 10% or 30 min, whichever is less, of the scheduled time will not be considered a protocol deviation.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version as of March 18, 2022.
